body: Thanks for reporting that. I missed that the token expired in the docs.

Do you happen to know which error code backblaze returned? 401?  Or was it something else?

There isn't much of a clue in the docs

https://www.backblaze.com/b2/docs/b2_authorize_account.html

I might just fetch a new one every hour - that would probably do it.
You could do if error code != 200, get new auth token. Same with the uploads. If the upload returns anything but 200, get a new URL.

issue.title: Allow multiple files to be uploaded at the same time

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: In addition to my issue #310, it would be awesome to add the ability to upload X files at a time to speed up massive uploads.

body:
The actual error is

```
x: Failed to copy: Failed to upload: Authorization token has expired (401 expired_auth_token)
```

issue.title: B2 401 expired_auth_token

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
When filing an issue, please include the following information if
possible as well as a description of the problem.

After a long time of uploading, I get error 401.

> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)
> v1.27
> 
> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
> Linux Fedora 22
> 
> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
> B2
> 
> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
> rclone sync /some/dir backblaze:foo
> 
> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

x: Failed to copy: Failed to upload: Authorization token has expired (401 expired_auth_token)

rclone could automatically get new token.

body:
I've fixed this.  It took a little while with a 24 hour test cycle! I've also fixed a number of other important B2 bugs!

Here is a beta for you to try.

http://pub.rclone.org/v1.27-41-g6b6b434%CE%B2/

Thanks for reporting the bug.

Nick

I don't have any massive uploads at the moment .-. I managed to break apart my massive upload to upload in sections. Also, I got to talk with the Backblaze CEO (Because I was hammering the B2 API with 750 concurrent uploads) and they suggest using multiple upload URLs when doing concurrent uploads.
See #373 for the multiple upload URLs - I've fixed that and there is a beta with that in on that issue!

issue.title: B2: authorization token has expired

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

Rclone 1.34, running on a raspberry pi 3 (with raspbian)

I'm currently in the progress of uploading a ton of data to B2, and unfortunately, issue #310  is still present.
I started rclone at [2016-11-21 19:48] (ah, don't we love logfiles)

After a bit over 24 hours, it started spouting these errors:

2016/11/22 19:59:52 data/5/50045: Failed to copy: Authorization token has expired (401 expired_auth_token)
2016/11/22 19:59:53
